page.title: 01ASHTON
page.content:
{Ashton }is a small village situated on the South West coast of Cornwall. It has a population of about 300 people. It lies on the lower slopes of Tregonning Hill, a large granite hill mass typical of Cornwall. It lies four miles west of Helston and ten miles east of Penzance. Many of the buildings in the village are quite old. Some, in the centre of the village, are over three hundred years old. These older buildings are built of {granite}and {metamorphic}rocks such as slate and shale. The newer buildings are made of concrete blocks.
